column4: Porsche race car engineer joins Apple: source
column5: FRANKFURT Apple poached the technical director of Porsche's race car program earlier this year  a company source said on Friday  hiring a project manager who helped engineer the sports car company's victorious return to the Le Mans endurance race.

column4: With bylaw tweaks  Apple grants activist one of three wishes
column5: BOSTON/SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc's board relaxed some rules for director nominations by outside investors but stopped short of broader changes sought by an activist shareholder.

column4: Apple can sell iPhone 7s in Indonesia after R&D investment commitment
column5: JAKARTA Apple Inc has committed to invest around $44 million in a research and development center in Indonesia over the next three years  a senior government official said  enabling it to start selling its latest iPhone 7 in the Southeast Asian nation.

column4: UK airline Monarch sees earnings flat in 2017 as competition bites
column5: LONDON Monarch [MONA.UL]  the British airline recently bailed out by its investment fund owner  expects broadly flat earnings for 2017  with pressure on fares offsetting growing demand for tickets.

column4: Mylan launches EpiPen generic at $300 per two-pack
column5: Mylan NV  which has come under fire for its drug pricing  said on Friday it would start selling a generic version of its life-saving EpiPen allergy treatment for $300 per two-pack  a more than 50 percent discount. | Video

column4: EU court ruling on Spanish tax breaks eyed for clues on Starbucks  Apple appeals
column5: BRUSSELS Europe's top court will decide next week on Spanish tax breaks for foreign takeovers in a ruling that may give clues as to how judges will deal with more complex tax cases involving Starbucks  and Apple .

column4: 3G will take another bite of Corporate America
column5: CHICAGO (Reuters Breakingviews) - The Brazilian billionaires at 3G Capital that turned Kraft Heinz and Anheuser-Busch InBev into mega-acquisition machines will dive back into the buying business in the coming year. Their next target should be Mondelez  the $66 billion food conglomerate that failed to coax chocolate-maker Hershey into a sale in 2016. A deal will require some unusual ingredients.

column4: Sumner Redstone to step down from Viacom board
column5: Controlling shareholder Sumner Redstone will step down from the Viacom  board of directors after the company's annual meeting in February  according to a company filing on Friday.

column4: Sumner Redstone to step down from Viacom board
column5: Controlling shareholder Sumner Redstone will step down from the Viacom  board of directors after the company's annual meeting in February  according to a company filing on Friday.

column4: Fund manager Virtus to buy RidgeWorth Investments for $513 million
column5: Fund manager Virtus Investment Partners Inc  said on Friday that it would buy RidgeWorth Investments for about $513 million to widen its client base.

column4: Fund manager Virtus to buy RidgeWorth Investments for $513 million
column5: Fund manager Virtus Investment Partners Inc  said on Friday that it would buy RidgeWorth Investments for about $513 million to widen its client base.

column4: One dead in accident at Agnico's Finland mine
column5: Agnico Eagle Mines Ltd said an employee of a local contractor died in an accident at their Kittila mine in northern Finland on Thursday.

column4: United States appeals against latest WTO Boeing subsidies ruling
column5: GENEVA The United States appealed on Friday against a ruling on tax breaks for Boeing  the World Trade Organization said on its website  the latest step in a more than a decade-old transatlantic spat over subsidies for Boeing and Airbus.

column4: CarMax  others to settle U.S. complaint over safety claims: FTC
column5: WASHINGTON CarMax Inc and two other used vehicle retailers have agreed to settle a federal complaint that they failed to disclose to buyers that some vehicles they were selling were under safety recall orders  the Federal Trade Commission said on Friday.

column4: Pushed by investor Ackman  Chipotle adds four new directors
column5: Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc   under pressure from activist investor Bill Ackman  named four new board members on Friday  paving the way for a reunion of sorts between its chief executive and a former top executive at McDonald's  which once owned the burrito chain.

column4: U.S. court revives long-running case over Edison International 401(k) plan
column5: A U.S. appeals court on Friday revived a nearly decade-old lawsuit by Edison International employees in California who say the utility favored higher-cost mutual funds over lower-cost ones in its retirement plan.

column4: Two Canadian gold miners shuffle top ranks
column5: TORONTO Two Canadian gold miners shuffled their executive ranks on Friday  as Goldcorp Inc promoted a senior vice president to replace Chief Operating Officer George Burns  hired by Eldorado Gold Corp as chief executive officer.

column4: InterOil says raises cap on additional cash payment in Exxon deal
column5: InterOil Corp  said it has increased the cap on an additional cash payment based on the output from a natural gas field in Papua New Guinea that was part of its sale agreement with ExxonMobil Corp .

column4: High-flying Freeport CEO steers towards new Indonesia mining deal
column5: JAKARTA Chappy Hakim  a retired air force chief who says he knows next to nothing about mining  now heads Indonesia's biggest copper producer  entrusted to use his connections to guide it through regulatory uncertainty to a renewed contract for its mine.

column4: GM expands testing  production of self-driving cars in Michigan
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co  Chief Executive Mary Barra said on Thursday the automaker will expand testing of self-driving vehicles to Michigan  and will build its next generation of self-driving cars in the Michigan plant that builds the Chevrolet Bolt electric car.

column4: Two Canadian gold miners shuffle top ranks
column5: TORONTO Two Canadian gold miners shuffled their executive ranks on Friday  as Goldcorp Inc promoted a senior vice president to replace Chief Operating Officer George Burns  hired by Eldorado Gold Corp as chief executive officer.

column4: Honeywell forecasts 2017 organic sales growth of 1-3 percent
column5: Aerospace parts maker Honeywell International Inc on Friday forecast 2017 organic sales growth rate to improve for the first time in three years  partly helped by the stabilizing oil and gas market.

column4: First Capital buys JPMorgan stake in Chinese securities joint-venture
column5: HONG KONG First Capital Securities Co Ltd  plans to acquire JPMorgan Chase & Co's  minority stake in a Chinese joint venture  in what would be the first departure by a prominent global investment bank from China's securities sector.

column4: Marathon Petroleum extends director deadline amid Elliott pressure
column5: Marathon Petroleum Corp.  extended its board director nomination deadline on Friday amid break-up pressure from hedge fund Elliott Management LP.

column4: Novartis says buys Ziarco Group to expand skin care portfolio
column5: ZURICH Novartis is buying privately held drugmaker Ziarco Group for an undisclosed sum to gain access to its investigational eczema medicine  the Swiss pharmaceutical giant said on Friday.

column4: Omnicom  Publicis get DoJ subpoenas over video production practices
column5: Subsidiaries for advertising companies Omnicom Group Inc and Publicis Groupe SA were subpoenaed by the U.S. Department of Justice  both companies said on Friday.

column4: Tech drags Wall Street lower; China tension weighs
column5: NEW YORK U.S. stocks fell on Friday  weighed by a more than 4 percent drop in Oracle shares  while recently battered stocks in the real estate and utilities sectors posted the largest gains. | Video

column4: Orange CEO under fire at Tapie affair trial of IMF's Lagarde
column5: PARIS French telecoms boss Stephane Richard was sharply criticized by one of the judges and by a witness during the negligence trial of IMF chief Christine Lagarde in Paris this week.

column4: Petrobras signs $5 billion Chinese financing and oil supply deal
column5: SAO PAULO Petróleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobras) has signed definitive terms for a $5 billion  10-year financing agreement with China Development Bank Corp and an oil supply accord with Chinese companies  as the Brazilian state-controlled oil company seeks to secure a stable stream of revenue and funding for the coming years.

column4: Brazil prosecutors hit ex-president Lula with more corruption charges
column5: SAO PAULO Prosecutors on Thursday charged former Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva  his wife and a former finance minister with more corruption charges in the investigation of graft at state-run oil company Petrobras.

column4: FDA drops black box warning on Pfizer's anti-smoking drug
column5: U.S. health regulators on Friday allowed Pfizer Inc to remove a serious warning from the label of its smoking cessation treatment  Chantix  giving a new lease of life to the controversial drug that was approved a decade ago.

column4: Praxair  Linde close to finalizing merger terms: sources
column5: Praxair Inc and Linde AG  the industrial gas companies that agreed earlier this month to revive merger talks  are close to finalizing the terms of the potential deal  people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

column4: Actelion's shares jump on report of Sanofi deal nearing
column5: Shares in Swiss biopharmaceuticals company Actelion  surged more than 8 percent to a record high after Bloomberg reported that talks with French suitor Sanofi  were nearing an agreement that could be worth about $275 per share.

column4: Sky's not the limit for European media mergers
column5: LONDON Rupert Murdoch's bid for Britain's Sky is expected to drive traditional European media players to do their own deals to attain the scale they need to compete with online platforms like Netflix for increasingly costly programs.

column4: Toyota recalls 66 830 imported Lexus cars in China
column5: BEIJING The Chinese unit of Toyota Motor Corp will recall 66 830 imported Lexus brand vehicles in the country over potential safety issues  China's quality watchdog said on Friday.

column4: New start-up wave challenges Japan's aversion to risk
column5: TOKYO A wave of start-ups is emerging in famously risk-averse Japan as cash-rich corporations increasingly delegate the task of keeping pace with technologies such as artificial intelligence and robotics to smaller  nimbler businesses.

column4: Unilever says to buy Living Proof hair care brand
column5: LONDON Unilever   said on Friday it would buy Living Proof  a premium hair care business  for an undisclosed price  the latest in a string of small deals for the company's personal care business.

column4: Yahoo under scrutiny after latest hack  Verizon seeks new deal terms
column5: NEW YORK Yahoo Inc  came under renewed scrutiny by federal investigators and lawmakers on Thursday after disclosing the largest known data breach in history  prompting Verizon Communications Inc  to demand better terms for its planned purchase of Yahoo's internet business. | Video

column4: Yahoo under scrutiny after latest hack  Verizon seeks new deal terms
column5: NEW YORK Yahoo Inc  came under renewed scrutiny by federal investigators and lawmakers on Thursday after disclosing the largest known data breach in history  prompting Verizon Communications Inc  to demand better terms for its planned purchase of Yahoo's internet business. | Video

column4: Wells Fargo says account openings fall in November
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  reported another decline in monthly consumer account openings  indicating that the bank is having trouble rebuilding its reputation after a sales scandal.
